name: Theo Kamecke
biography: Theo Kamecke (October 18, 1937 - May 23, 2017) was a sculptor, who previously worked as a film director during the 1960s and 1970s.  Kamecke's best known film is Moonwalk One - a NASA commissioned documentary feature film to cover their Apollo 11 mission in the summer of 1969. Theo's other influential films included The Incredible Bread Machine Film, and To Be Alive, which he worked as a film editor on. Since the 1980s, Theo has worked as a sculptor, working in the medium of early electronic circuits.  His work has been purchased by film director James Cameron.
